summary: A utility for creating and managing HTTP digest authentication password files for Apache. It allows creating new password files, adding users, and changing passwords for existing users in specified realms using MD5 hashing.

logs.reason: Prompts the user to enter a new password for authentication
The entered password exceeds the maximum allowed length (MAX_STRING_LEN)
logs.resolution: User should enter a shorter password that fits within the system limit

logs.reason: Prompts the user to confirm the password by typing it again
The two password entries don't match, indicating a typing error
logs.resolution: User should try the password creation process again, ensuring both entries match exactly

logs.reason: Displays the correct command syntax when improper arguments are provided
logs.resolution: User should follow the specified syntax to properly use the tool

logs.message_template: The -c flag creates a new file.
logs.reason: Explains the purpose of the -c option as part of the usage information
The program was interrupted by a signal (SIGINT, typically Ctrl+C)
logs.resolution: If interruption was unintentional, restart the command; otherwise, no action needed

logs.reason: Error initializing character encoding translation (in EBCDIC environments)
logs.resolution: This is likely a system configuration issue. Check that the required character encodings are available on the system

logs.message_template: Could not open passwd file %s for writing: %pm
logs.reason: Failed to open the password file for writing when creating a new file
logs.resolution: Check file permissions, directory existence, and disk space. Ensure the user running the command has write access to the specified location

logs.reason: Informational message indicating a new password is being added for the specified user and realm
The system couldn't identify a temporary directory for creating intermediate files
logs.resolution: Check that TMPDIR, TMP, or TEMP environment variables are set correctly and point to a valid, writable directory

logs.reason: Failed to create or open a temporary file needed for updating the password file
logs.resolution: Check permissions on the temp directory, disk space, and file system permissions

logs.message_template: Could not open passwd file %s for reading.
logs.reason: Failed to open the existing password file for reading when updating it
logs.resolution: Verify the file exists and the user has read permissions for it

logs.message_template: Use -c option to create new one.
logs.reason: Suggestion to use -c option when attempting to modify a non-existent password file
logs.resolution: Run the command again with the -c option to create a new password file

logs.message_template: The following line contains a string longer than the allowed maximum size (%i): %s
logs.reason: Found a line in the password file with a username or realm that exceeds the allowed length
logs.resolution: Manually edit the password file to correct the oversized entries, or recreate the affected entries with shorter values

logs.message_template: Changing password for user %s in realm %s
logs.reason: Informational message indicating a password is being changed for an existing user
Informational message indicating a new user is being added to the password file
Failed to update the original password file with the new data from the temporary file
logs.resolution: Check file permissions, disk space, and whether another process might be locking the destination file
